13 
14 class SonarMap:
15  """
16  Ported from C++ by Ivan Vishiakou
17  Original description still applies:
18 
19  This class implements the sonar map algorithm as described in "Sonar-Based
20  Real-World Mapping and Navigation" by Alberto Elfes, IEEE Journal Of
21  Robotics And Automation, Vol. RA-3, No. 3, June 1987.
22 
23  Map coordinates vs. map cells
24 
25  The map works internaly on a discrete, integer-based grid, but exposes a
26  more natural continuous coordinates interface. This allows an application
27  to work with the map using its own units (in this documentation refered to
28  as "meters"), without taking care of details of the map storage
29  implementation.
30 
31  Each cell with integer coordinates (c_x, c_y) occupies the space from
32  ((c_x - 0.5, c_y - 0.5) * resolution) exclusive to
33  ((c_x - 0.5, c_y + 0.5) * resolution) inclusive.
34 
35  The value resolution is the length of a cells edge. All cells are considered
36  to be squares.
37 
38  Note: if a variable name starts with the prefix "m_", then this variable
39  contains a map coordinate. If the name starts with "c_" then this variable
40  contains a cell coordinate. This convention applies both to the functions'
41  arguments and internal/local variables.
42  """
43 
44 
45  def __init__(self, resolution, m_size_x, m_size_y):
46  """
47  This constructor creates a map of given dimensions.
48 
49  Args:
50  resolution (float) : size of a cell, measured in meters, i.e. the length of
51  the edge of a cell.
52  m_size_x (float) : initial size of the map in x direction (meters).
53  m_size_y (float) : initial size of the map in y direction (meters).
54  """
55  self._resolution = resolution
56  self._c_size_x = int(round(m_size_x/resolution+2))|1
57  self._c_size_y = int(round(m_size_y/resolution+2))|1
58  self._m_size_x = resolution*self._c_size_x
59  self._m_size_y = resolution*self._c_size_y
60  self._m_min_x = -self._m_size_x/2.0
61  self._m_min_y = -self._m_size_y/2.0
62 
63  self._map_combined = MapStore(self._c_size_x, self._c_size_y)
64  self._map_free = MapStore(self._c_size_x, self._c_size_y)
65  self._map_occupied = MapStore(self._c_size_x, self._c_size_y)
66  self.r_min = 0.05
67  self.probability_occ = []
68  self.probability_empty =[]
69  self.sum_occupied = None
70  self.cone_valid = []
71 
72 
73 
74  def add_scan(self, m_sonar_x, m_sonar_y, sonar_theta, field_of_view,
75  max_range, registerd_range, uncertainty):
76  """
77  Update map using a sonar reading.
78 
79  Args:
80  m_sonar_x (float) : x coordinate of the sonar in map coordinates.
81  m_sonar_y (float) : y coordinate of the sonar in map coordinates.
82  sonar_theta (float) : orientation of the sonar in map coordinates.
83  fov (float) : opening angle of the sonar (radians).
84  max_range (float) : maximum possible range of the sonar (meters).
85  distance (float) : range reading returned from the sensor (meters).
86  uncertainty (float) : the noise associated with the sensed distance,
87  expressed as the standard deviation.
88  """
89 
90 
91  #============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
92  """
93  Instructions: implement the routine that performs map update based on a
94  single sonar reading.
95 
96  Hint: use convertToCell( and convertToMap() functions to convert between
97  map and cell coordinates.
98 
99  Hint: use MapStoreCone class to iterate over the cells covered
100  by the sonar cone.
101 
102  Hint: you may use helper functions provided to you (euclidian_distance,
103  angular_distance, clamp)
104 
105  Some snippets for your convenience.
106  MapStoreCone creating:
107 
108  cone = MapStoreCone(c_sonar_pos_x, c_sonar_pos_y, sonar_theta,
109  field_of_view, c_cone_length)
110  the last argument is cone length in cells (since all the linear sizes it operates
111  are in terms of cells!)
112 
113  Iterating over cone cells:
114  for cell in cone:
115  #Do stuff
116  # cell is a tuple (c_x, c_y)
117  pass
118 
119  Reading/Setting cells of the map (MapStore):
120 
121  occ_val = self._map_occupied.get(*cell) # cell = (c_x, c_y = )
122  occ_val = self._map_occupied.get(c_x, c_y) #
123 
124  self._map_occupied.set(c_x, c_y, new_occ_val) # setting map cell value
125 
126  Hint: see the _convert_to_map(cell) function description. It can be used
127  to check whether a cell is in bounds of the map. (You do not need to set/read
128  cells that lie beyond the map grid)
129 
130  Alternatively you can use
131  self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(c_x) # returns boolean
132  self._map_combined.is_in_y_range(c_y) # returns boolean
133 
134  //============================================================================
135  """
136 
137  cell_x,cell_y = self._convert_to_cell((m_sonar_x ,m_sonar_y))
138  c_cone_length = int(max_range/self._resolution)
139 
140  max_x = m_sonar_x + registerd_range*math.cos(sonar_theta)
141  max_y = m_sonar_y + registerd_range*math.sin(sonar_theta)
142 
143  cone = MapStoreCone(cell_x,cell_y, sonar_theta,
144  field_of_view, c_cone_length)
145  self.probability_empty =[]
146  self.probability_occ =[]
147  self.cone_valid =[]
148  for cell in cone :
149  cell_position = cell
150  if(self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(cell[0]) and self._map_combined.is_in_y_range(cell[1])):
151  #converting to map space to calculate delta and theta values
152  map_val_cell = self._convert_to_map(cell_position)
153 
154  delta_value = self.euclidian_distance(m_sonar_x,m_sonar_y,map_val_cell[0],map_val_cell[1])
155 
156  point_theta = math.atan2(( map_val_cell[1]-m_sonar_y ),(map_val_cell[0]-m_sonar_x))
157  theta_value = self.angular_distance(point_theta,sonar_theta)
158 
159  #calculate probability for free sapce within the given delta range(distance uncertainty)
160  point_erf = self._er_free(registerd_range,delta_value,uncertainty)
161  #calculate the probability of the cell being the obstacle within the given sonar angle(angular uncertainty)
162  point_ea = self._ea(field_of_view,theta_value)
163 
164  # calculate probability for occupied sapce within the given delta range
165  if registerd_range < max_range-0.05 : #handles open sonar readings
166  point_erocc = self._er_occ(registerd_range,delta_value,uncertainty)
167  else:
168  point_erocc = 0.0
169 
170  if ((delta_value < registerd_range - uncertainty) and point_ea>0) :
171  #distance uncertainty
172  point_erf = self._er_free(registerd_range,delta_value,uncertainty)
173  #angular uncertainty
174  point_ea = self._ea(field_of_view,theta_value)
175 
176  #Enhance empty values
177  prob_emp = point_ea * point_erf
178  emp_val = self._map_free.get(cell[0],cell[1])
179  emp_val_curr = prob_emp
180  new_emp_val = emp_val + emp_val_curr - emp_val*emp_val_curr
181 
182  #checking and thresholding the probability range
183  if(new_emp_val)> 1.0:
184  new_emp_val = 1.0
185  elif new_emp_val < -1.0:
186  new_emp_val = -1.0
187  self._map_free.set(cell[0],cell[1],new_emp_val)
188  else:
189  prob_emp = 0
190  if(delta_value > (registerd_range - uncertainty) and (delta_value < registerd_range + uncertainty)):
191  prob_occ = (point_ea * point_erocc)*(1.0- prob_emp)
192  else:
193  prob_occ = 0
194 
195  self.probability_empty.append(prob_emp)
196  self.probability_occ.append(prob_occ)
197  self.sum_occupied = sum(self.probability_occ)
198  self.cone_valid.append(cell)
199 
200 
201 
202  for i,cell in (enumerate(self.cone_valid)):
203  if(self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(cell[0]) and self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(cell[1])):
204 
205  occ_val = self._map_occupied.get(cell[0], cell[1])
206  if self.sum_occupied < 1e-3:
207  new_occ_val = occ_val
208  else:
209  #normalize with sum of occupied probabilities
210  occ_val_curr = self.probability_occ[i]/self.sum_occupied
211  new_occ_val = occ_val + occ_val_curr - occ_val*occ_val_curr
212  #checking and thresholding the probability range
213  if(new_occ_val)> 1.0:
214  new_occ_val = 1.0
215  elif new_occ_val < -1.0:
216  new_occ_val = -1.0
217 
218  #Enhance occupied values
219  self._map_occupied.set(cell[0], cell[1], new_occ_val)
220 
221  com_val = self._map_combined.get(cell[0],cell[1])
222  if (self._map_occupied.get(cell[0],cell[1])>self._map_free.get(cell[0],cell[1])):
223  self._map_combined.set(cell[0],cell[1], self._map_occupied.get(cell[0],cell[1]))
224  else:
225  self._map_combined.set(cell[0],cell[1], -self._map_free.get(cell[0],cell[1]))
226

231 
232 
233  def _er_free(self, sensed_distance, delta, uncertainty):
234  """
235  Calculate free-space probability.
236 
237  This function calculates the probability to be free for a point that is
238  delta meters away from the sonar's origin when the sonar has measured a
239  distance of sensed_distance with given uncertainty. This function only
240  computes the radial component of the probability. To fully specify
241  a point you need a distance and an angle and as such for the full
242  probability you need the angular probability of the point to be the cause
243  of the measured sensed_distance. This is calculated by _ea().
244  The full probability is the product of the result from _ea() and from this
245  function.
246 
247  Args:
248  sensed_distance (float) : distance in meters measured by the sonar.
249  delta (float) : distance from the sonar's origin for which the probability
250  should be calculated.
251  uncertainty (float) : uncertainty (variance) of measured distance.
252  Returns:
253  float : The probability to be free for a point delta meters away from
254  the sonar's origin. The value is in the range 0.0 to 1.0.
255  """
256 
257  #============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
258  #Instructions: compute the distance probability function for the "probably
259  # empty" region.
260  e_f = 0.0
261  if ((delta > sensed_distance - uncertainty) or (delta < self.r_min)):
262  return 0.0
263  else:
264  e_f = 1.0 - pow(((delta - self.r_min)/(sensed_distance - uncertainty-self.r_min)),2)
265  return e_f
266 
267 
268  def _er_occ(self, sensed_distance, delta, uncertainty):
269  """
270  Calculate occupied-space probability.
271 
272  This function calculates the probability to be occupied for a point that
273  is delta meters away from the sonar's origin when the sonar has
274  measured a distance of sensed_distance with an uncertainty of
275  uncertainty. This function only computes the radial component of
276  the probability. To fully specify a point you need a distance and an angle
277  and as such for the full probability you need the angular probability of
278  the point to be the cause of the measured sensed_distance.
279  This is calculated by _ea(). The full probability is the product of the
280  result from _ea() and from this function.
281 
282  Args:
283  sensed_distance (float) : distance in meters measured by the sonar.
284  delta (float) : distance from the sonar's origin for which the probability
285  should be calculated.
286  uncertainty (float) : uncertainty (variance) of measured distance.
287 
288  Returns:
289  float : The probability to be occupied for a point delta meters away
290  from the sonar's origin. The value is in the range 0.0 to 1.0.
291  """
292 
293  #============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
294  #Instructions: compute the distance probability function for the "probably
295  # occupied" region.
296  o_r = 0.0
297  if (delta > (sensed_distance + uncertainty) or (delta < sensed_distance - uncertainty)):
298  return 0.0
299  else:
300  o_r = 1.0 - pow(((delta - sensed_distance)/uncertainty),2)
301  return o_r
302 
303 
304 
305 
306  def _ea(self, sonar_fov, theta):
307  """
308  Probability for a point in the sonar cone to be actually measured.
309 
310  This function calculates the probability of a point theta radians away
311  from the center beam of a sonar cone of sonar_fov angular width, to be
312  the cause of a sonar measurement.
313 
314  Args:
315  sonar_fov (float) : the opening angle of the sonar cone in radians.
316  theta (float) : the angular distance of a point from the center of the
317  sonar cone, measured in radians. This value must lie within plus/minus
318  sonar_fov / 2.
319 
320  Returns:
321  float : Probability of a point in the sonar cone to be measured,
322  value in range 0.0 to 1.0 as a funciton of angular distance to the
323  central line of the sonar cone.
324  """
325 
326  #============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
327  #Instructions: compute the angular probability function (it is same for both
328  # the "probably empty" and the "probably occupied" region.
329 
330  #Angular uncertainity
331  e_a = 0.0
332  if (theta > - sonar_fov/2 and theta < sonar_fov/2):
333  e_a = 1.0 - pow(((2.0*theta)/(sonar_fov)),2)
334  print '********' , e_a
335  return e_a
336  else:
337  return 0.0

339 
340  def _convert_to_map(self, c_pos):
341  """
342  Converts cell coordinates to metric coordinates. Examples:
343  m_pos = convert_to_map(c_pos) #c_pos = (c_x, c_y)
344 
345  returns tuple (m_x, m_y) or None if cell coordinates out of bounds
346  """
347  c_x, c_y = c_pos
348  if ( self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(c_x) and
349  self._map_combined.is_in_y_range(c_y) ):
350  return (c_x*self._resolution, c_y*self._resolution)
351  else:
352  return None
353 
354 
355  def _convert_to_cell(self, m_pos):
356  """
357  Converts metric coordinates cell coordinates. Examples:
358  c_pos = convert_to_map(m_pos) #m_pos = (m_x, m_y)
359 
360  returns tuple (c_x, c_y) or None if cell coordinates out of bounds
361  """
362  m_x, m_y = m_pos
363  c_x, c_y = int(round(m_x / self._resolution)), int(round(m_y / self._resolution))
364  if ( self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(c_x) and
365  self._map_combined.is_in_y_range(c_y) ):
366  return (c_x, c_y)
367  else:
368  return None

397 
398  @staticmethod
399  def euclidian_distance(*args):
400  """ Returns euclidian distance between two points:
401  dist = euclidian_distance(pos1, pos2)
402  dist = euclidian_distance(x1, y1, x2, y2)
403  """
404  try:
405  if len(args) == 2:
406  #tuples
407  return math.sqrt((args[0][0]-args[1][0])**2+(args[0][1]-args[1][1])**2)
408  elif len(args) == 4:
409  #x's and y's:
410  return math.sqrt((args[0]-args[2])**2+(args[1]-args[3])**2)
411  else:
412  raise Exception('Invalid arguments for euclidian_distance()')
413  except Exception as e:
414  print "Exception caught:", e.message
415 
416 
417  @staticmethod
418  def angular_distance(a1, a2):
419  """Returns angular distance between two angles"""
420  return math.atan2(math.sin(a1-a2), math.cos(a1-a2))
421 
422 
423  @staticmethod
424  def clamp(value, min_val, max_val):
425  """Helper function to clamp a variable to a given range."""
426  return max(min(value, max_val), min_val)
